intro: Microseris breviseta, commonly known as the short-haird toothcup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees. The plant produces small, round seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
